Detailed Description

File descriptor of an entry in the AssetManager.

This provides your own opened FileDescriptor that can be used to read the data, as well as the offset and length of that entry's data in the file.

Definition at line 27 of file AssetFileDescriptor.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum

Length used with getDeclaredLength when a length has not been declared.

This means the data extends to the end of the file.

Enumerator:
UNKNOWN_LENGTH 

Definition at line 43 of file AssetFileDescriptor.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::content::AssetFileDescriptor::AssetFileDescriptor ( const gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor &  fd,
int64_t  startOffset,
int64_t  length 
)

Create a new AssetFileDescriptor from the given values.

Parameters:
fdThe underlying file descriptor.
startOffsetThe location within the file that the asset starts. This must be 0 if length is UNKNOWN_LENGTH.
lengthThe number of bytes of the asset, or UNKNOWN_LENGTH if it extends to the end of the file.
gaia::content::AssetFileDescriptor::~AssetFileDescriptor ( )

Member Function Documentation

storage::FileOutputStream* gaia::content::AssetFileDescriptor::createOutputStreamN ( )

Create and return a new auto-close output stream for this asset.

This will either return a full asset AutoCloseOutputStream, or an underlying ParcelFileDescriptor.AutoCloseOutputStream depending on whether the the object represents a complete file or sub-section of a file. You should only call this once for a particular asset.

gaia::content::AssetFileDescriptor::DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN ( AssetFileDescriptor  ) [private]
int64_t gaia::content::AssetFileDescriptor::getDeclaredLength ( ) const

Return the actual number of bytes that were declared when the AssetFileDescriptor was constructed.

Will be UNKNOWN_LENGTH if the length was not declared, meaning data should be read to the end of the file.

gaia::storage::FileDescriptor* gaia::content::AssetFileDescriptor::getFileDescriptorN ( ) const

Returns the FileDescriptor that can be used to read the data in the file.

int64_t gaia::content::AssetFileDescriptor::getStartOffset ( ) const

Returns the byte offset where this asset entry's data starts.
